title: Untitled Indiana Jones Project
plot_outline: The plot is unknown at this time.
keywords: [u'sequel', u'indiana-jones', u'fifth-part', u'character-name-in-title']
taglines: [u"It looks like we don't have any Taglines for this title yet."]
trivia: [u'John Williams was announced to return to compose the fifth film.', u'Rumors of Chris Pratt and even Bradley Cooper possibly assuming the titular role of Indiana Jones were laid to rest as of October 27th, 2015 with confirmation from the studios attached that Harrison Ford would be reprising the role of Indy.', u'Harrison Ford said on a popular UK chat show that he would reprise his role as Indiana Jones again in a "New York minute."', u'John Rhys-Davies has expressed interest in reprising his role as Sallah from Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981) and Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989).', u'This will be the first Indiana Jones film without the involvement of creator George Lucas.', u'With this film now being released in 2020. Harrison Ford plays Indiana Jones for 39 years since the first film, Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981) making him the second actor to play a film character in a film series spanning 39 years. The first actor is Sylvester Stallone playing Rocky Balboa from Rocky (1976) to Creed (2015).', u'This is the 30th theatrical film directed by Steven Spielberg.', u'According to Variety in 2014, an article penned by Peter Caranicas, deputy editor at the Hollywood trade magazine, so misinformation is not something to be expected within the article\'s content. About midway through the article, Caranicas recaps some of the projects Janusz Kaminski worked as a cinematographer on. Then he caps the paragraph with the following line, "His next project is the upcoming fifth Indiana Jones movie." Kaminski is a long time collaborator for Steven Spielberg as his cinematographer. If Kaminski is in fact already planning to serve as cinematographer on Indiana Jones 5 (2020) then work on the film must be further along than any of us realize. Indiana Jones 5 (2020) rumors have been swirling around for several years but this was the first mention about the project\'s future.', u"In a Entertainment Weekly interview with screenwriter David Koepp, he confirmed that the character Henry 'Mutt' Walton Jones III which was played by Shia LaBeouf & introduced in Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull (2008) is not going to be involved in the film. While Koepp didn't mention why the character & LaBeouf wouldn't be involved it could be assumed part of the reason for this decision is because of the negative reception both the character of Mutt & Shia LaBeouf received from critics & audiences.", u'Set to be released 11 years after the release of Kingdom of the Crystal Skull when Harrison Ford was 65 years old.', u'Will coincide with the 30th Anniversary of Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989).', u"Comedian John Mulaney (in his album new in town) he talks about what he would do if he saw hitler and says if he sees someone in the outfit he wouldn't kill them because he doesn't want to ruin Indiana Jones 5 (2020).", u'The film, which is the fifth and final instalment in the Indiana Jones film series,', u"Steven Spielberg has stated Indiana Jones won't be killed off.", u'David Koepp finished the script in September 5, 2017, he announced that Mutt Williams was written out from the story, thus Shia LeBouf will not appear, news that fans received with praise.']
release_dates: [u'Brazil::9 July 2020', u'Russia::9 July 2020', u'UK::10 July 2020', u'Lithuania::10 July 2020', u'Turkey::10 July 2020', u'USA::10 July 2020', u'Germany::18 July 2020']

title: Bumblebee
plot_outline: On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small Californian beach town. Charlie, on the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken.
keywords: [u'spin-off', u'based-on-toy', u'alien', u'robot', u'sixth-part', u'sequel']
taglines: [u"It looks like we don't have any Taglines for this title yet."]
trivia: [u"This won't be a sequel but a spin-off based on the popular Autobot Bumblebee, as well as a prequel tale to the Transformers films.", u'This film is set in 1987. The 1980s era was when the Transformers saga was born.', u'Optimus Prime and Ultra-Magnus are said to be in the film. The character of Strongarm might appear.', u"Bumblebee's alternate mode in this feature is a Volkswagen Beetle, his original mode in The Transformers (1984).", u"This is director Travis Knight's first live-action film.", u'Is rumoured to explain how Bumblebee lost his voice box. (Fight with Megatron as mentioned in the 1st Transformers live action film)', u'John Cena is the second wrestler to appear in a "Transformers" feature, after Dwayne Johnson (who played Cliffjumper in Transformers Prime (2010)). Cena is also the third wrestler to appear in a Michael Bay feature, after Johnson (who was in Bay\'s film Pain & Gain (2013)) and Stephen Farrelly (who played Rocksteady in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows (2016))', u'This is the first Transformers film not to be directed by Michael Bay, however he will stay on board as producer.', u'A street sign reads "Bay View." This is a reference to producer Michael Bay.', u'A cinema hall holds a poster for Gremlins (1984). This film was produced by "Transformers" producer Steven Spielberg and starred "Transformers" veteran voice actors Peter Cullen and Frank Welker.', u'Peter Cullen has confirmed that he will be return as the voice of Optimus Prime in the film.', u'Hailee Steinfeld is the latest in the line of actors/actresses who have worked with Joel & Ethan Coen to have went on to have a role in a live-action Transformers film. Others are John Turturro, John Goodman, Frances McDormand, Steve Buscemi, and John Malkovich.', u'Stephen Schneider and Tom Virtue who have also been in the Transformers film series have all been on the TV series "You\'re the Worst".', u'In an interview Hailee Steinfeld revealed that her "Edge of Steventeen" writer/director/producer Kelly Fremon Craig did a rewrite of the script.', u'The first Transformers film since 1986 that is not directed by Michael Bay.']
release_dates: [u'Germany::20 December 2018', u'USA::21 December 2018', u'Sweden::4 January 2019']

trivia: [u'Rumors speculate that Sam Neill, Laura Dern might return for the sequel as their characters Alan Grant and Ellie Sattler respectively.', u'On 13th August 2015 it was announced that the Jurassic World (2015) sequel will be released in the UK before being released in the US. Release date is set to be June 7th 2018.', u'The Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018) will be released 25 years after Jurassic Park (1993), 21 years after The Lost World: Jurassic Park (1997), 17 years after Jurassic Park III (2001), and three years after Jurassic World (2015).', u'This is the fifth film in the Jurassic Park (1993) franchise and the second film in the Jurassic World (2015) trilogy.', u'The film\'s tagline, "Life Finds a Way" is a quote said by Ian Malcolm from Jurassic Park (1993).', u'Nina Gold is the casting director for this sequel. Filming will take place in the United Kingdom and Hawaii.', u'Reunites Spider-Man 3 (2007) supporting actors James Cromwell and Bryce Dallas Howard.', u'Rafe Spall is the second Life of Pi (2012) actor to star in a Jurassic park movie. Irrfan Khan was in Jurassic World.', u'Geraldine Chaplin appeared in the film Chaplin (1992) for director Richard Attenborough, who appeared in the original Jurassic Park (1993).', u'B.D Wong and Jeff Goldblum previously starred in Jurassic Park together as their characters Henry Wu and Ian Malcolm in a scene together.', u'Claire and Owen will officially return for the sequel', u'It is currently being speculated that a volcano will play a role in the narrative, this is seamingly confirmed due to producer frank marshall stating on twitter that he is working on two films that involve volcanoes.', u"Early rumors claimed that Dr Wu and Hoskin's plans to weaponize dinosaurs would take center stage in the sequel, which was said to be called Jurassic War. However, most of these rumors have been shot down by people involved in the project"]

title: Ready Player One
plot_outline: When the creator of a virtual reality world called the OASIS dies, he releases a video in which he challenges all OASIS users to find his Easter Egg, which will give the finder his fortune. Wade Watts finds the first clue and starts a race for the Egg.
keywords: [u'virtual-reality', u'player', u'outcast', u'screenplay-adapted-by-author', u'pac-man', u'three-word-title', u'based-on-novel', u'number-in-title', u'based-on-young-adult-novel']
taglines: [u"It looks like we don't have any Taglines for this title yet."]
trivia: [u'Christopher Nolan, Robert Zemeckis, Matthew Vaughn, Peter Jackson, and Edgar Wright were all considered to direct this film.', u'As of March 25th, Steven Spielberg is attached to direct this film. Spielberg himself is actually mentioned in the original novel by Ernest Cline that this film is based on. Spielberg has stated that he will be removing references of his movies.', u'On August 11, 2015, a rumour began circulating that Steven Spielberg was "courting" Gene Wilder to play OASIS creator James Halliday, making Ready Player One the first film Wilder has done since 1999. However, Wilder guest starred as \'Elmer\' on Yo Gabba Gabba.', u'Before his untimely death, Gene Wilder was approached by Steven Spielberg, who wanted him to appear in the film, (as well as "The BFG"). Wilder respectfully declined.', u'Michael Keaton was considered for J.D Halliday.', u"The music score was originally going to be composed by longtime Steven Spielberg collaborator John Williams, however, due to scheduling conflicts working on another Spielberg film The Post (2017), he left and was replaced by Alan Silvestri. This is only the third film where Spielberg isn't working with Williams.", u"Ready Player One (2018) depicts characters from pop culture staples from the '80s & '90s, such as The Iron Giant (1999), Tron (1982), Akira (1988), Lord of the Rings (2001-2003), Back to the Future (1985), A Nightmare on Elm Street (1984) Lara Croft (1996), and Duke Nukem (1991) just to name some of the characters in the film.", u'Ready Player One (2018) was scheduled to be released on December 15, 2017. The date was pushed back until March 30, 2018 to avoid competition with Star Wars: The Last Jedi (2017).', u'Elle Fanning and Lola Kirke were considered for the role of Art3mis before Olivia Cooke was cast.', u'The teaser trailer contains an orchestral version of the song "Pure Imagination" from the film \'Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory\'. It also contains a segment of the song "Tom Sawyer" by the band Rush.', u'Ready Player One (2018) marks the first Steven Spielberg-directed film project for Warner Bros. Pictures since A.I. Artificial Intelligence (2001) in 2001. Prior to the Ready Player one, he only produced a handful of films - particularly Letters from Iwo Jima (2006) and Hereafter (2010) for Warner Bros.', u"Steven Spielberg's first science fiction film since War of the Worlds (2005).", u'Nick Robinson, Nat Wolff, and Dalton Vaughn were considered for the role of Wade Watts/Parzival before Tye Sheridan was cast.', u"The character of F'Nale Zandor, was not in the book and was written just for the movie.", u'The film also marks the first Warner Bros. Pictures production since Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007) to be co-produced by Dreamworks Pictures. in the case of Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007), it was co-producted with Warner Bros. Pictures, Village Roadshow Pictures and Amblin Entertainment.', u'Some controversy surrounded the film when Tye Sheridan was cast due to the fact that casting website CastIt.Com had advertised that this film was looking for unknown talent for the lead role. Several people sent in their audition videos in hopes of being cast as the casting call said "unknown talent". When news of Tye Sheridan\'s casting broke out less than a day after the casting campaign on CastIt had ended, the reaction of people who auditioned ranged from understanding that they likely wouldn\'t be picked as they were "unknown" to outraged by the fact that they had been lied to.', u'The third collaboration of Mark Rylance and Steven Spielberg with Bridge of Spies (2015) and The BFG (2016).', u'This will be the first time Steven Spielberg and Simon Pegg have worked together since The Adventures of Tintin (2011).', u"Vin Diesel will be reprising the voice of the Iron Giant, 19 years after first voicing the character in Brad Bird's 1999 animated film 'The Iron Giant'.", u'Based on Sci-fi Novel by Ernest Cline', u"Mark Rylance's character is named as James Donovan. This is the second Steven Spielberg and Mark Rylance movie to have a character's name, James Donovan. The first one is Bridge of Spies (2015), played by Tom Hanks.", u'A passage from the novel Ready Player One describes Wade\'s obsession and "research" of Anorak\'s Almanac, Halliday\'s journal chock full of \'80s references to books, movies, TV shows, music, and video games. One of the filmographies that Wade studied from the Almanac was Steven Spielberg\'s, who just so happens to be directing this film adaptation.', u"A worldwide casting call for the lead role of 'Wade Watts', was advertised in late 2014 to early 2015, on major casting and media websites in search for unknown talent.", u'Both Tye Sheridan and T.J. Miller starred in an X-Men movie. Tye was in X-Men: Apocalypse (2016) and Miller was in Deadpool (2016).', u'Although Steven Spielberg has stated that many references to himself that are seen in the book have been removed from the film, he has confirmed that Wade will still have his custom DeLorean, which is a prominent element in the Spielberg-produced Back to the Future films.', u'During a panel discussion at San Diego Comic-Con, Steven Speilberg confirmed that the titular character from the film "The Iron Giant (1999)" will be a major part of this film.']
release_dates: [u'France::28 March 2018', u'Argentina::29 March 2018', u'Australia::29 March 2018', u'Czech Republic::29 March 2018', u'Denmark::29 March 2018', u'Greece::29 March 2018', u'Hong Kong::29 March 2018', u'Hungary::29 March 2018', u'Netherlands::29 March 2018', u'New Zealand::29 March 2018', u'Russia::29 March 2018', u'Bulgaria::30 March 2018', u'UK::30 March 2018', u'Ireland::30 March 2018', u'Romania::30 March 2018', u'Sweden::30 March 2018', u'USA::30 March 2018', u'Brazil::5 April 2018', u'Germany::5 April 2018']

title: The Post
plot_outline: A cover-up that spanned four U.S. Presidents pushed the country's first female newspaper publisher and a hard-driving editor to join an unprecedented battle between journalist and government. Inspired by true events.
taglines: [u"It looks like we don't have any Taglines for this title yet."]
trivia: [u"This is the second film coming out in 2017 about a historical high-profile whistleblower case. Spielberg's The Post (2017) is based on Daniel Ellsberg and the release of the secret 'Pentagon Papers', while Landesman's Mark Felt: The Man Who Brought Down the White House (2017) is based on 'Mark Felt' and the Watergate scandal. Both films feature by coincidence Canadian actor Bruce Greenwood.", u"Was filmed after director Steven Spielberg's Ready Player One (2018) but is slated to release before.", u"This is Liz Hannah's first produced screenplay which was picked up as a spec script by producer Amy Pascal.", u'Meryl Streep and Tracy Letts previously collaborated together in the film August Osage County (2014) which was written by Tracy Letts.', u'This is the fifth feature film collaboration of actor Tom Hanks and director Steven Spielberg. The earlier films were [in chronological order]: Saving Private Ryan (1998), Catch Me If You Can (2002), The Terminal (2004), and Bridge of Spies (2015).', u'Bob Odenkirk and Jesse Plemons both previously starred in Breaking Bad (2008), while Carrie Coon and Michael Stuhlbarg previously starred in the third season of Fargo (2014), which also featured Odenkirk and Plemons in previous seasons.', u"This is the first major film collaboration of actress Meryl Streep and director Steven Spielberg. Streep's only other collaboration with Spielberg was on A.I. Artificial Intelligence (2001) when Streep did a voice over role in the film.", u"The original title for the screenplay was called The Post (2017) but was scrapped once the project was put into pre-production as it was renamed & retitled 'The Papers' but the project would again change it's title in the post-production stage back to its original title, The Post (2017).", u'With this film, his fifth collaboration with Steven Spielberg, Tom Hanks broke his tie with Harrison Ford to be the actor that Spielberg has directed the most times. Ford has also been directed by Spielberg five times, but his scene in E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982) was cut from the final film.', u'This is the first onscreen acting film collaboration and star teaming of actor Tom Hanks and actress Meryl Streep. The pair have both previously been credited for two pictures the two have both worked on but not in a top billing acting context. Streep did voice work for The Ant Bully (2006) and starred in Mamma Mia! (2008) which Hanks respectively was a producer and executive producer on.', u'David Cross and Bob Odenkirk have worked together on various projects before, most famously the sketch comedy series Mr Show with Bob and David (1995-1998).', u'This film features four actors who previously appeared in the FX anthology series Fargo (2014) Bob Odenkirk appeared in Season 1, Jesse Plemons appeared in Season 2, and Carrie Coon and Michael Stuhlbarg appear in Season 3.', u'This is the third film collaboration between actors Tom Hanks and Bradley Whitford. Their two prior films together were: Philadelphia (1993) & Saving Mr. Banks (2013)', u"The film is co-screenwriter Josh Singer's third film exploring the importance of journalism in uncovering political scandal following The Fifth Estate (2013) which surrounds Julian Assange's Wikileaks organization and Spotlight (2015) which follows the Boston Globe's investigation into Catholic child sex abuse allegations.", u'Sarah Paulson and Bruce Greenwood also starred in American Crime Story: The People vs. O.J.', u'The film was shot under the working title, "Nor\'Easter."']
release_dates: [u'USA::22 December 2017 (limited)', u'Bulgaria::12 January 2018', u'Sweden::12 January 2018', u'USA::12 January 2018', u'UK::19 January 2018', u'Argentina::1 February 2018', u'Brazil::1 February 2018', u'Germany::22 February 2018']

title: The Kidnapping of Edgardo Mortara
plot_outline: The treatment of a young Jewish boy, forcibly raised as a Christian in 19th century Italy, creates a furor which pits the Papacy itself against forces of democracy and Italian unification.
taglines: [u"It looks like we don't have any Taglines for this title yet."]
trivia: [u'This is the third collaboration between Steven Spielberg and Mark Rylance after Bridge of Spies (2015) and The BFG (2016). The fourth will be Ready Player One (2018)', u'In the early development stages, Steven Spielberg and DreamWorks Pictures were in talks with Harvey Weinstein and the Weinstein Company about collaborating on this film, but could not reach a consensus on various aspects of the production. Both have since gone their separate ways, with Spielberg and DreamWorks producing this film, and Weinstein and the Weinstein Company developing their own separate project about Edgardo Mortara.', u'This is the third collaboration between screenwriter Tony Kushner and director Steven Spielberg after M\xfcnchen (2005) and Lincoln (2012).', u"Oscar Isaac was attached to star in the film for some time while the film was in development but the project's progression slowed as it was on an international search to find its lead role for the child of Edgardo Mortara. The project then took a backseat when Steven Spielberg unexpectedly signed on to direct The Post (2017) which was getting fast tracked to get into production which led to Isaac dropping out of the film project once Spielberg signed on to do The Post (2017) which put the status of the film project on hold while they continue to their search for the lead role."]

title: The Talisman
plot_outline: To save his mother from certain death, young Jack Sawyer enters a parallel world known as the Territories in search of a powerful talisman.
keywords: [u'based-on-the-works-of-stephen-king', u'based-on-novel']
taglines: [u"It looks like we don't have any Taglines for this title yet."]
trivia: [u'A movie version of Stephen King and Peter Straub\'s book "The Talisman" was planned many years earlier. Paperback editions published in 1985 bore the line "Soon to be a major Motion Picture" on the cover (the back cover of the UK edition said, "Soon To Be A Major Film")', u'Part of a large web of interconnected stories written primarily by Stephen King. The book this film is based on is followed by \'Black House\' and both books deal, in part, with King\'s "The Dark Tower" series.', u'Will Smith was set to be in the movie in late-1990s, but the production was halted and Smith went on to other films.', u'Originally purchased by Universal in 1984 for Steven Spielberg to direct, Spielberg left the project in limbo for over a decade before work began anew on it.', u"Mick Garris was to have directed a four hour miniseries of The Talisman before the project was scrapped in favor of a theatrical version. The producers loved the script, but the network wouldn't put up the money needed to film it.", u'Edward Zwick also dropped out as the director for this film. He came on board after Vadim Perelman was no longer attached, but Zwick also left after a couple of months.', u'Vadim Perelman was to have directed the film version in 2004, but left the project during preproduction.', u'Was rumored to star Michael J. Fox.']

This is a reference to Jimmy Palmer, the Medical Examiner's Assistant in NCIS", u'Dr Bull played by Micheal Weatherly has his Trial Analysis Corporation (TAC). title: Transformers: The Last Knight
plot_outline: Autobots and Decepticons are at war, with humans on the sidelines. Optimus Prime is gone. The key to saving our future lies buried in the secrets of the past, in the hidden history of Transformers on Earth.
keywords: [u'based-on-toy', u'fifth-part', u'sequel', u'order', u'bumblebee', u'planet', u'english', u'reference-to-albert-einstein', u'reference-to-arthur-c.-clarke', u'arthur-c.-clarke-quotation', u'star-wars-reference', u'reference-to-star-wars', u'altered-version-of-studio-logo', u'stonehenge', u'robot', u'tank', u'ship', u'aircraft-carrier', u'abs', u'slain', u'flood', u'sinking', u'submarine', u'che-guevara', u'book', u'black-dress', u'high-heels', u'round-table', u'traffic-light', u'swastika', u'nazi-flag', u'nazi', u'singing', u'bowling', u'fallout', u'elevator', u'castle', u'mansion', u'walking-stick', u'smoking', u'butler', u'fleeing', u'car-collision', u'chopper', u'running', u'laser', u'machine-gun', u'wheel', u'treadmill', u'noria', u'explosion', u'presentation', u'shouting', u'transformation', u'chosen-one', u'talisman', u'dancing', u'sheriff', u'slow-motion', u'motorcycle', u'bicycle', u'pterodactyl', u'triceratops', u'tyrannosaurus-rex', u'heels', u'paint', u'pentagon', u'gas-station', u'desert', u'museum', u'interrogation', u'female-jockey', u'horse-riding', u'polo', u'wealthy', u'strong-female-character', u'finger-pointing', u'jet', u'nemesis', u'missile', u'glasses', u'truck', u'jeep', u'red-car', u'moving-crew', u'yellow-car', u'shooting', u'kid', u'capsule', u'spaceship', u'crash', u'phone-call', u'stadium', u'monitor', u'streets', u'radar', u'dock', u'city', u'map', u'platoon', u'army', u'research', u'china', u'junkyard', u'car', u'space', u'android', u'three-heads', u'dragon', u'cave', u'voice-over', u'valley', u'drinking', u'fire', u'arrow', u'bow', u'sword', u'shield', u'axe', u'wood', u'horse', u'knight', u'flag', u'battle', u'african-american', u'teenager', u'caucasian', u'profanity', u'swearing', u'violence']
taglines: [u'Rethink your heroes', u'Every legend hides a secret', u'There comes a moment when we are called upon to make a difference.', u'For one world to live, the other must die.', u'They have been here forever.']
trivia: [u'The scenes of Sir Edmund Burton (Sir Anthony Hopkins) visiting 10 Downing Street, were filmed at the actual office of the British Prime Minister in October 2016.', u'With a budget of $217 million dollars, the most expensive Transformers at the time of release.', u'Mark Wahlberg announced this will be his last Transformers movie as Cade Yeager. He had signed a contract for three films, with the knowledge that he could be relieved earlier.', u'Writer Matt Holloway is a fan of the drama Downton Abbey (2010), and jokingly said that Jim Carter (who plays the butler Mr. Carson in the show) should voice Cogman. He was shocked when Michael Bay got Carter signed on as Cogman.', u'Director Michael Bay is a noted dog lover, and he cast Freya, a British dog with epilepsy that many homes had rejected, in the film.', u"Quintessa's design is based on Alpha Q's design in Transformers: Energon (2004) (a humanoid upper body with tentacles for legs), and the Quintesson's facial designs in The Transformers (1984) (a face with a headdress). The headdress incorporates elements of the Autobot and Decepticon insignias, reflecting her role as the Transformers creator.", u'Tyrese Gibson was set to return as Robert Epps, but he was unable to appear in the film due to scheduling conflicts with The Fate of the Furious (2017).', u"After the release of Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014), a writers' room was set up to plan the franchise's future beyond the main film series. Two of the ideas pitched involved the Arthurian myth and World War II respectively. Michael Bay liked them so much that he decided to incorporate them into the script for this film.", u'Michael Bay said that this will be the last Transformers film he will direct, for the moment. He is open to doing more films in the future, if he gets a good story.', u'This film was released a decade after the first Transformers live-action film.', u"Blenheim Palace was decorated as a Nazi headquarters for the World War II scenes. This caused controversy among British war veterans, who protested that the palace was the former residence of war hero Winston Churchill, and did not deserve such treatment. Michael Bay explained that this was part of the film, and Churchill's grandson Sir Nicholas Soames lambasted the British press for sensationalizing a mere film scene.", u'Hot Rod is the second Lamborghini Transformer to appear after Lockdown in Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014). Generally, each Transformer in these films has a unique vehicle mode.', u"Onslaught's original alternate mode in The Transformers (1984) was an anti-aircraft truck, but this was revised to a Western Star tow truck. His green color is an homage to the Autobot Tow-Line in Transformers: Robots in Disguise (2000), who was a green tow truck.", u'While shooting in England, Mark Wahlberg spent time at St. Aidan\'s Church incognito, and made donations. No one knew anything until afterwards. Reverend Father Des McGiven said, "It\'s great that we had him in for the service, and we appreciate his generosity towards our church."', u'Steve Buscemi voiced Daytrader in this film. Michael Bay had wanted Steve Buscemi to play Agent Simmons in Transformers (2007), but he was unavailable.', u'Shia LaBeouf appeared in this film, although it was only his portrait.', u'This is the second Hollywood movie to be shot in Cuba after The Fate of the Furious (2017). Coincidently, Tyrese Gibson played a major role in the first three Transformers movies and in The Fast and the Furious franchise.', u'This film features the myth of King Arthur. Michael Bay was previously going to direct King Arthur (2004), and had worked on that film for five years, before leaving it, due to budget issues.', u"A physical prop of Sqweeks was built at Isabela Moner's request.", u'The first Michael Bay film to be shown in the 1.85:1 aspect ratio since his debut film Bad Boys (1995).', u'Michael Bay originally wanted to pass on directing this film, but was persuaded to do one more by Peter Cullen.', u"Optimus Primal, Optimus Prime's successor in Beast Wars: Transformers (1996), was going to appear in the film as a Kight of Cybertron with a gorilla design.", u'Liam Garrigan (King Arthur) also played the character King Arthur in the television series Once Upon a Time (2011).', u'Peter Cullen, Reno Wilson, and Mark Ryan are the only actors to appear in all five live-action Transformers films, with Cullen as Optimus Prime, Wilson playing Frenzy, Mudflap, Brains, Mohawk, and Sqweeks, and Mark Ryan voicing Bumblebee, Jetfire, a military drone operator, Lockdown, and Bulldog.', u'Part of the film was shot at Stonehenge. Michael Bay requested to shoot an explosion on the location, but was denied, so he had a set of Stonehenge constructed to shoot the explosion.', u'Voice actors John Goodman, Steve Buscemi, and John Turturro appeared in The Big Lebowski (1998).', u'Hot Rod has a French accent in the film. His voice actor Omar Sy is actually French, and is exaggerating his native Parisian accent.', u'Bulldog, the Mark IV tank Transformer, is based on the tank transformers Warpath from The Transformers (1984) (a slightly unhinged robot) and Blitzwing from Transformers: Animated (2007) (a robot who wears a helmet and monocle).', u'Many of the scenes were filmed in the north east of England, with several streets in Newcastle Upon Tyne brought to a standstill, while scenes were completed.', u'A portion of the Loop 303 freeway in Arizona was shut down for five days in mid June 2016 for filming.', u"Hot Rod's French accent was Michael Bay's idea, as he thought it would give Hot Rod a unique character.", u"It seems that this movie places Trinity College in England. It is in fact in Dublin, Ireland (during the shot of the Long Room, you can even see the famous Harp of Brian Boru, used on Ireland's Coat of Arms, the Irish Euro, and the Guinness Beer logo among other things), and houses the Book of Kells, a famous illuminated manuscript.There is a Trinity College that is part of Oxford University and the film indicates the location of those scenes is Oxford.", u"Hot Rod's alternate mode in The Transformers: The Movie (1986) and The Transformers (1984) was a concept car and a Ford GT, but this was revised to a Citro\xebn DS, and later a Lamborghini Centenario.", u"It's possible that Barricade is the only Decepticon that has never died.", u'The Decepticon Nitro Zeus was named after Nitro Zeus, the code name for a shelved American offensive plan.', u'The Knights of Cybertron have their ship hidden in a mountain range in England. The Autobots had their base in a similar location in The Transformers (1984), although that was in America.', u'This is the second Michael Bay film to have a World War II setting, after Pearl Harbor (2001).', u'Ken Nolan wrote the role of Sir Edmund specifically for Sir Anthony Hopkins.', u'The filmmakers admitted that there were production difficulties in this film, which resulted in a lot of material planned and filmed, but which never made it to the film.', u'Sir Anthony Hopkins is the third Marvel Cinematic Universe actor to star in a Transformers movie, after Hugo Weaving (the voice of Megatron in the first three films), and he is the second actor from the RED comic book movies to do so after John Malkovich (Bruce Brazos in Transformers: Dark of the Moon (2011)).', u'This is the second Transformers installment for Stanley Tucci, who played Merlin. Previously he played Joshua Joyce in Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014).', u'The Autobot Topspin from Transformers: Dark of the Moon (2011) appears in this film, but with a head akin to Leadfoot\'s, and a new name, "Volleybot".', u'Omar Sy (Hot Rod) is the fourth actor from the X-Men franchise to appear in a Transformers feature. The previous three actors were Ty Olsson (Mithcell Laurio in X2: X-Men United (2003)), who played Downshift in Transformers: Energon (2004), Kelsey Grammer (Beast/Hank McCoy), and T.J. Miller (Weasel), who were both in Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014).', u"This is Jim Carter's third live-action adaptation of an animated show, movie, or book adaptation, after 102 Dalmatians (2000) and Alice in Wonderland (2010).", u'In the mission control room, Moving Picture Company (MPC) Visual Effects Editor Leah Jones can be seen as N.A.S.A. scientist.', u"Topspin is the only wrecker that is confirmed to be still alive. Roadbuster's status is unknown, and Leadfoot is dead, as footage of him being hunted by the cemetery wind was shown in Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014).", u'This was the first movie to be filmed almost entirely with IMAX 3D cameras with two ARRI Alexa IMAX cameras mounted onto a 3D rig with an astounding 98% of IMAX footage in the film.', u'Laura Haddock sent her video audition to director Michael Bay in the US and he was so impressed he traveled to London to meet with her to discuss the role. She later received a call from him with an offer of the part.', u"Jim Carter (Cogman) and Phoebe Nicholls (Aunt Helen) previously worked together in ITV's Downton Abbey (2010).", u'Sir Anthony Hopkins and Phoebe Nicholls appeared in The Elephant Man (1980).', u'Despite his seeming death during Transformers: Dark of the Moon (2011), the police car Decepticon Barricade returns, and has apparently survived up to the events of this movie, with a completely new design, including a new vehicle mode.', u"Megatron has a new helmet design, based on his classic bucket-head look from The Transformers (1984). He was originally to have this helmet look in Transformers (2007), but the filmmakers decided it wasn't menacing enough, and passed the head design to Starscream.", u'Cogman is classified as a Headmaster, a Transformer that serves as a head for a larger robot. Although he does not carry this out in the film, a toy of his was released, showcasing this ability.', u'The film contains tributes to Transformers Prime (2010): Earth is revealed to be the planet-eating Transformer Unicron. Optimus briefly loses his identity. An ancient breed of Transformer, who can transform into a dragon appears (Predacons, Knights). The final battle is set in the sky, with the Decepticons trying to engage a machine that will destroy the Earth, and the Autobots fighting to stop them.', u"The Transformers' creator is Quintessa is based on the Quintessons from The Transformers (1984) (in that show the Transformers' creators, who resided on the homeworld of Quintessa), but incoporates elements of Solus Prime, a female Transformer god from Transformers Prime (2010).", u'Quintessa turns Optimus Prime into her minion. This is an homage to The Transformers: Dark Awakening (1986), where the Quintessons reprogrammed Optimus Prime to do their bidding.', u'Cade (Mark Wahlberg) and the Autobots use a junkyard as a base. This is an homage to Transformers: Robots in Disguise (2014), where the Autobots used a junkyard as a base with the help of its human owner.', u'Vivian is a descendant of Merlin. In Arthurian legend, Vivian is the name of the Lady of the Lake.', u'Optimus Prime is only seen in vehicular mode once in the entire film.', u'Quintessa gives Optimus Prime the nickname "Nemesis Prime" when he initially turns evil. This is a reference to a character of the same name that is an evil clone of Optimus, which shows up from time to time in the Transformers fiction, either as a piloted mech or a different character entirely.', u'Optimus Prime has no on-screen transformation in the entire film. He only appears as a truck at the end of the movie.', u"In the movie, it is mentioned that Fidel Castro allows Transformers to live in peace in Cuba. Since then, Castro died on November 25, 2016, it implies that the movie was filmed before his passing, in the way that there wasn't time to change his mention.", u'Sir Edmund (Sir Anthony Hopkins) is killed by Megatron in the same way, in a reverse role of the way Harold Attinger (Kelsey Grammer) was killed by Optimus in Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014).', u'In an alternate version of the film, Nitro Zeus tells the guard that his wife is cheating on him, but in another version he requests the guard to say, "Hi," to his wife for him. Interestingly, John DiMaggio did not play Nitro in the first version of this scene. Instead, Steven Barr, the voice of Berserker, played Nitro.', u'Onslaught dies in a way similar to how Ratchet died in Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014). They lost their right legs and they were shot many times and had some of their parts fall off because of it. But while Ratchet died after Lockdown ripped out his spark, Onslaught died after Drift decapitated him. And while Ratchet died over the span of a few minutes, Onslaught died in a few seconds.', u'Transformers: Viimeinen ritari (2017) is the first film in the live-action series to feature Bumblebees true voice.', u'This is the second Transformers film in which Megatron loses his right arm to Optimus Prime in the final battle. The first was Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen (2009).']

title: All the Way
plot_outline: becomes the President of the United States in the chaotic aftermath of 's assassination and spends his first year in office fighting to pass the Civil Rights Act.
keywords: [u'president', u'civil-rights-act', u'civil-rights', u'voting-rights', u'political', u'vice-president', u'jfk', u'u.s.-senate', u'congress', u'senate', u'u.s.-senator', u'senator', u'presidential-candidate', u'political-candidate', u'politics', u'election', u'presidential-election', u'campaign', u'presidential-campaign', u'campaigning', u'political-campaign', u'election-campaign', u'vietnam-war', u'vietnam', u'secretary-of-defense', u'u.s.-vice-president', u'march', u'rally', u'protest', u'racial', u'jackie-kennedy', u'rfk', u'camelot', u'jfk-assassination', u'jacqueline-kennedy', u'kennedy-assassination', u'civil-liberties', u'voter-rights', u'commander-in-chief', u'american', u'america', u'usa', u'black-vote', u'black', u'american-south', u'democrat-leader', u'american-politics', u'all-the-way', u'political-history', u'white-house', u'oval-office', u'martin-luther-king', u'mlk', u'hubert-humphrey', u'john-f-kennedy', u'lyndon-johnson', u'lady-bird-johnson', u'ladybird', u'democratic-national-convention', u'democrat-party', u'lbj', u'airforce-one', u'texas', u'dallas', u'discrimination', u'prejudice', u'racial-issues', u'kennedy', u'democrat', u'democrat-president', u'american-political-history', u'american-president', u'racial-prejudice', u'racism', u'racial-tension', u'racial-discrimination', u'race-relations', u'u.s.-president', u'u.s.-congress', u'1960s', u'activism', u'civil-rights-movement']
taglines: [u'Politics is war.']
trivia: [u"Right after Democrat President Lyndon Johnson signs the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Senator Dick Russell (who is played Frank Langella) walks off into an adjoining room, obviously very upset. He's then seen standing and looking at a painting of President Harry S. Truman, as Johnson comes into the same room after him. The reason this is important is because President Truman unsuccessfully tried passing a major Civil Rights Bill in 1948, and Russell, a segregationist, had a leading role in blocking Truman's bill. Russell had a long track record for defeating civil rights legislation via use of the filibuster. However, he was unsuccessful in his leadership and efforts to defeat Johnson's bill.", u'The film\'s source "All the Way" play won the 2014 Tony Award for Best Play and Bryan Cranston won Best Actor in a Play for his role as Democratic President Lyndon Johnson.', u'The film was made and first released about four years after its source Tony Award winning play by Robert Schenkkan had been first performed in 2012. Schenkkan also penned the tele-play for this tele-movie. The play also starred Bryan Cranston as Lyndon Johnson who reprised his role in this movie.', u'Many of the scenes in the film are based upon real transcripts and conversations.', u'Frank Langella\'s 6\'3" height had to be concealed from the camera during filming, since the real Richard Russell was actually shorter than Lyndon Johnson (reflected in a famous photograph of Johnson leaning over Russell)', u'Democratic President Lyndon Johnson plays a practical joke on Hubert H. Humphrey by driving his open-top car directly into a lake, but the car is able to float. The car is the famous Amphicar, built from 1961 to 1965, and the incident is based on reality in that Lyndon Johnson did own an Amphicar, and he would play this exact trick on his friends.', u'Lyndon Johnson was succeeded in office by Richard Nixon, who was played by Frank Langella in Frost/Nixon (2008). Director Jay Roach claimed that Langella would have fun between takes slipping into character as Nixon.', u'Democratic President Lyndon Johnson continued the FBI\'s wiretapping of Martin Luther King Jr. that was previously authorized by the Kennedy Administration of President John F. Kennedy. As a result of listening to the FBI\'s tapes, remarks on King\'s extra-marital activities were made by several prominent officials, including Johnson, who once said that King was a "hypocritical preacher."', u'Second collaboration between Bryan Cranston and director Jay Roach. Cranston previously starred in Trumbo (2015).', u"Director Jay Roach's fourth movie about elections and campaigns. He previously directed Recount (2008), Game Change (2012), and The Campaign (2012).", u"The film portrays Martin Luther King's Nobel Prize acceptance speech for being awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1964 as being just before the election on 3rd November that year, but it actually occurred on 10th December of '64.", u'Democratic President Lyndon Johnson (Bryan Cranston) sends FBI agents to investigate the three missing freedom fighter boys in Mississippi. These events are portrayed in the movie Mississippi Burning (1988).', u'Democratic President Lyndon Johnson is one of four people who have served as President and Vice President, as well as in both houses of Congress.', u'The film cast includes one Oscar winner: Melissa Leo; and two Oscar nominees: Bryan Cranston and Frank Langella.', u'The footage shows the Swedish Nobel comittee announcing the Peace prize when in effect it is the Norwegian comittee that awards and announces the prize.', u'Kevin Dunn previously played J. Edgar Hoover in Chaplin (1992). Stephen Root portrays Hoover in All the Way (2016)', u"Bradley Whitford was previously married to Jane Kaczmarek, who played Bryan Cranston's wife on Malcolm in the Middle (2000).", u"Bryan Cranston and Ray Wise have both played Commissioner Gordon in animated Batman features. Cranston played the part in Batman: Year One (2011), while Wise played the part in Batman: The Killing Joke (2016). On 'Gotham (2015)(TV)', the part is played by Ben McKenzie, who is Robert Schenkkan's nephew.", u'Actors Ray Wise and Frank Langella both previously appeared in Good Night, and Good Luck. (2005).', u'Actors Ray Wise and Bryan Cranston both previously appeared in How I Met Your Mother (2005).', u'One of two features films about former American Democrat President Lyndon Johnson which were made and first released in the year of 2016. The films are LBJ (2016) and All the Way (2016).', u'While discussing what happened to Walter Jenkins, Democratic President Lyndon Johnson (Bryan Cranston) discusses the certain male mannerisms with J. Edgar Hoover (Stephen Root). Hoover himself was an alleged closeted cross-dresser.', u'Stephen Root, who plays J. Edgar Hoover, was previously in J. Edgar (2011) with Leonardo DiCaprio in the title role.', u'Though Democratic President Lyndon Johnson was a naval officer, he has a Marine Corps flag in the Oval Office. There is no service flag in the replica Oval Office at the LBJ Presential Museum.']
