taglines: [u'...the Beatles legend begins', u"these youngsters are suffering from a highly contagious disease called beatlemania. The symptoms are...screaming hysteria hyperventilation fainting fits seizures and spasmodic convulsions It isn't fatal but it sure is fun."]
trivia: [u"Director Robert Zemeckis' feature debut, as well as his first of many collaborations with producer Steven Spielberg. Despite the film's relatively modest budget (approximately $2.8 million), Universal Studios were uneasy with Spielberg's choice in hiring the unproven director. To prevent Zemeckis from being fired, executive Ned Tanen made Spielberg agree that if Zemeckis was doing a markedly poor job, Spielberg would step in and direct the film himself. This way, Universal could hardly lose: they would either have given a new whiz-kid director his first chance, or they would have gained another Spielberg film to release.", u'First film executive produced by Steven Spielberg.', u"Four of the film's stars -- Bobby Di Cicco, Wendie Jo Sperber, Nancy Allen, and Eddie Deezen -- would go on to appear in 1941 (1979), which was directed by Steven Spielberg and written by Bob Gale and Robert Zemeckis.", u'Although they did not film in The Beatles suite at the Plaza Hotel, while on a promotional tour for the movie in April, 1978, some cast members did stay a few days in that exact suite while in New York City.', u'Two of this film\'s stars -- Wendie Jo Sperber and Marc McClure -- would go on to have supporting roles in the "Back to the Future" trilogy, written by Bob Gale and Robert Zemeckis, directed by Zemeckis, and produced by Steven Spielberg.', u'The character of Pam appears to be a reference to the song "Polythene Pam". The character exhibits fetishistic behaviors towards the objects and instruments in the Beatles\' room, then hides under the bed to watch them change clothes. "Polythene Pam" was based on an experience John Lennon had with a couple who experimented in kinky fetish sex, including wearing polythene (polyethylene) plastic bags.', u'The Beatles song that this film is named for is officially "I Want To Hold Your Hand". However, because of the way the song is sung, the refrain is commonly heard as "Wanna", hence the film title.', u'The film takes place from February 8 to February 9, 1964.', u'Although the movie takes place in 1964, the titles of three of The Beatles\' songs from later on in their career are mentioned: "Helter Skelter" (woman in hotel elevator says, "Things are all Helter Skelter"), "Get Back" (what the police tell the teenagers as they attempt to save Janis and Peter), and "909" (as in "The One After 909") - 909 is the room number of the man who wants a call girl.', u"Eddie Deezen's character is named in part after someone Bob Gale worked with in St. Louis during an amateur film shoot.", u"Will Jordan, as Ed Sullivan, announces next week's acts after The Beatles finish their segment. He says that a young man will appear who does an impersonation of him (Ed Sullivan), named Will Jordan.", u'When one of the girls from Brooklyn (Sherry Lynn) tells Tony Smerko (Bobby Di Cicco) that he looks like Paul, he assumes that she means Paul Newman rather than Paul McCartney. Newman was the father of actress Susan Kendall Newman (Janis Goldman).', u'The February 7, 1964 issue of "Time" is seen in the Beatles\' hotel room. Maurice Couve de Murville, the French Minister of Foreign Affairs from 1958 to 1968, is depicted on the cover.', u"None of the twelve Lennon-McCartney songs used in this picture were published in the U.S.A. by Maclen Music, which handled most of the Beatles' song publishing. The Lennon-McCartney songs used in this picture, and their respective U.S. publishers at the time of production were:Love Me Do, P.S. I Love You (Beechwood Music); Please Please Me (Dick Jmes Music); Do You Want To Know A Secret? (Metric Music); Thank You Girl (Conrad Music); From Me To You, I Saw Her Standing There, Misery, There's A Place, She Loves You, I Wanna Be Your Man (Gil Music); and, I Want To Hold Your Hand (Duchess Music).", u'Although Beatles songs have been translated and recorded by hundreds of foreign artists, "I Want To Hold Your Hand" is one of only two songs that were recorded in another language by the Beatles themselves. In 1964, at the height of Beatlemania, the Beatles traveled to Paris for their only studio recording session outside the UK. Along with a new English single ("Can\'t Buy Me Love"), they recorded two of their existing songs in German: "I Want To Hold Your Hand" ("Komm, Gib Mir Deine Hand") and "She Loves You" ("Sie Liebt Dich"). The songs were translated by Luxembourg lyricist Camillo Felgen, and taught to the Beatles phonetically. Oddly, while the stereo masters of the English versions of these songs have been lost (only mono masters exist), the German versions have both stereo and mono masters.', u'The scene in which Larry Dubois (Marc McClure) finds inner courage and saves Grace Corrigan (Theresa Saldana) from being attacked by Al (Claude Earl Jones) is highly similar to the scene to Back to the Future (1985) in which the similarly wimpy character George McFly (Crispin Glover) saves his future wife Lorraine Baines (Lea Thompson) from Biff Tannen (Thomas F. Wilson). Larry and George both said, "Get your goddamn hands off her!" before punching the attacker. Both this film and Back to the Future (1985) were directed by Robert Zemeckis and co-written by him and Bob Gale, while McClure and Wendie Jo Sperber (Rosie Petrofsky) played George and Lorraine\'s two eldest children Dave and Linda in the later film. Read Morgan (Peter\'s Father) and Ivy Bethune (Foreign Woman) also appeared in both films.']

plot_outline: Woman indencovers into a man,because she wants to fight in World War I.

taglines: [u"It looks like we don't have any Taglines for this title yet."]
trivia: [u'Steven Spielberg was 13 years old when he made this movie.', u'Spielberg wanted to have explosions during the battle scene. He asked his father to pick up supplies at a drug store but he said no. So Spielberg put a small, thin plank on a stick with dirt on the other side. When the actors stepped on the contraption, the dirt was thrown into the air creating a somewhat believable ground explosion.']

title: Lego Dimensions
plot_outline: When a mysterious and powerful vortex suddenly appears in various LEGO worlds. Batman, Gandalf and Wyldstyle bravely jump into the vortex...
keywords: [u'ghost', u'gremlin', u'dimension', u'portal', u'wii-u']
taglines: [u'Break the Rules', u"You're gonna need a bigger imagination."]
trivia: [u"Because of the game's unique crossover nature, certain characters will often have special dialogue whenever they are paired together. For instance, Doc Brown (voice of Christopher Lloyd) of Back to the Future (1985) and The Doctor (voice of Peter Capaldi) will critique each other's mode of time travel transportation.", u'This is the first time that Chris Pratt plays two different characters from two different franchises in one story. His roles are Emmet from The Lego Movie (2014) and Owen Grady from Jurassic World (2015). When paired together, they might have an interesting conversation.', u"For the Doctor Who packs, the only ones to reprise their roles from the show are Peter Capaldi (Twelfth Doctor), Jenna Coleman (Clara Oswald), Michelle Gomez (Missy), John Leeson (K-9), John Barrowman (Captain Jack Harkness), Strax (Dan Starkey), Madam Vastra (Neve McIntosh) and Nicholas Briggs (The Daleks and Cybermen). The other Doctor Who stars' voices are archive footage.", u'The Fourth Doctor is the only incarnation of The Doctor that has two TARDIS interiors in the game. His second TARDIS console room is based on the Secondary Console Room seen in Season 14 and can be accessed by entering the TARDIS on the fourth consecutive day in a month (the 4th, 8th, 12th, 16th etc).', u'While 20th Century Fox agreed to the use of "The Simpsons" characters in the game, they were not able to afford to bring in the original actors to reprise their characters. Therefore, the dialogue of Homer and Krusty are pulled from clips of actor Dan Castellaneta from the series. The Simpsons-themed added level is based on the episode The Simpsons: The Mysterious Voyage of Homer (1997)', u"Chell from Portal (2007) is the only playable character who didn't make a single sound, even when hit.", u'On June 9, 2016, it was revealed that a number of new waves were coming for Year 2. Starting September 30, 2016 up until Summer of 2017, new packs will be released, including franchises such as: Sonic the Hedgehog, Adventure Time, Teen Titans Go, The Goonies, The Powerpuff Girls, The A-Team, the 2016 incarnation of the Ghostbusters, and many, many more. These new waves will also introduce story packs and 4-player battle mode.', u'Wave 6 has been confirmed to release on September 27th, 2016, and will include packs for Adventure Time, Mission Impossible, The A-Team, Harry Potter, and the 2016 incarnation of the Ghostbusters.', u"In game, due to Sonic's fear of water, he wears a scuba mask and life jacket, and swims using backstroke.", u'Wave 7 has been confirmed to release on November 18th, 2016, and will include packs for Sonic the Hedgehog, Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Then, Gremlins, E.T., and an Adventure Time Fun Pack.', u'Robert Firth is one of several actors who has portrayed the maniacal character Master Chen, over the years. Other actors include Ian James Corlett and William Salyers. The Lego projects are sometimes produced in different locations throughout the world, with post production often occurring simultaneously in the US, the UK and other countries. Firth is based in both London and Los Angeles.', u'All the universes that are in this game are (per Year 1): Jurassic World, Ninjago, Scooby-Doo, Doctor Who, Back to the Future, Ghostbusters, DC Comics, The Lego Movie, Wizard of Oz, Portal 2, Lord of the Rings, and so many more.', u"Using the Doctor's TARDIS, characters can travel to hidden areas from different franchises like Bedrock from The Flintstones (1960) and Orbit City from The Jetsons (1962). Both locations are featured in series created by Hanna-Barbera, the owners of Scooby Doo, Where Are You! (1969). These could be seen as Easter eggs to future game additions.", u"All IP's owned by Disney were excluded from the game (Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, etc). However with the cancellation of Disney Infinity (2013), the characters used in that game could now possibly be included in Lego Dimensions Year 3 as there isn't any other Toys to Life game involving Disney owned IP's."]
release_dates: [u'USA::27 September 2015', u'UK::29 September 2015', u'Netherlands::29 September 2015']

taglines: [u'They know what scares you.']
trivia: [u'In a Q&A, Saxon Sharbino admitted that she had never seen the original Poltergeist (1982) until filming was complete on this production.', u'Rosemarie Dewitt wanted to do the film, after she experienced the engaged and lively audience reaction at the premiere of The Conjuring (2013), which she attended because it featured her husband Ron Livingston.', u'The bumper sticker on the Bowen vehicle during the last scene of the film says: Hooper High School. This is a direct reference to Tobe Hooper, who directed the 1982 original version.', u'Tom Cruise and Richard Armitage were considered for the role of Eric Bowen.', u'Parapsychologist/Anomalist Christopher Chacon, one of the world\'s foremost authorities on "poltergeists", was utilized by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer/20th Century Fox studios as their official expert on the phenomenon to internationally publicize and promote the release of the movie.', u"The original cut ran for 101 minutes with 7-8 minutes of footage missing from the theatrical cut. This footage will supposedly be released as a director's cut on the DVD and Blu-ray release.", u"Kennedi Clements' theater screen debut.", u'Almost half of the costumes and props used in the movie were sold to a fan in England before the movie hit theaters.', u'Not screened in advanced for Critics.', u"In the original 1982 version, the brother's name is Robbie, whereas in this version, it's Griffin. This may be an homage to Dominique Dunne, who played the eldest sister and who was murdered 5 months after the release of Poltergeist. Her brother's name is Griffin Dunne, best known from An American Werewolf in London.", u'The director stated that the house they filmed in is haunted', u'The Light the spirits need to reach in order to move on was also part of the original Poltergeist trilogy; it may derive from war stories that pilots claim to have seen in combat.', u'The first film that 20th Century Fox and MGM actually produce together. Fox has handled international distribution for MGM since the early 2000s, as well as distributing MGM titles on Blu-ray and DVD since 2006, though the two studios have never actually collaborated for a film project outside of distribution.', u'The movie was shot in the fall of 2013', u"Gil Kenan's first job as a director since City of Ember (2008).", u"Sam Rockwell, Rosemarie DeWitt, and Jane Adams' second film working together after co-starring in Joe Swanberg's indie film Digging for Fire (2015).", u'Rosemarie DeWitt and Jared Harris both had roles in the series Mad Men (2007).', u'Natasha Calis was considered for the role of Kendra Bowen.', u'Amy talks to Eric about becoming a coach, Craig T. Nelson who played the original father in Poltergeist, played Coach Hayden Fox on the TV series Coach (1989).', u'The bent spoon that was used in the film was sold to a fan in New York.', u'Jared Harris and Jane Adams previously appeared together in Happiness (1998).', u'Second movie for Saxon Sharbino and Sam Rockwell together. They previously starred in indie film Trust Me (2013).', u"Both 'Kyle Catlett' and 'Susan Heyward' had roles on the FOX thriller series The Following (2013).", u'When Eric and Amy are at the dinner party and learn about the cemetery, the host of the party jokes that it at least wasn\'t an Indian burial ground. In the original film, the house was also built on an old cemetery, and many believe it was an Indian burial ground, the "Family Guy" episode "Petergeist" even parodying the original film and saying it was an Indian burial ground.']

title: Medal of Honor: Pacific Assault
plot_outline: You play through the eyes of soldiers in various engagements of the Pacific Theatre of World War II.
keywords: [u'pacific', u'pearl-harbor-attack', u'pearl-harbor', u'epic-battle', u'first-person-shooter', u'1940s', u'mission-briefing', u'saga', u'world-war-two', u'sequel', u'rifle', u'pistol', u'pacific-theater', u'pacific-ocean', u'military', u'medal-of-honor', u'machine-gun', u'japan', u'gun', u'army']
taglines: [u"You don't play, you volunteer.", u'This is not a game. This is war.']
trivia: [u'A dead pig can be found during the start of the Guadalcanal level. It was put in there as an inside team joke as the team had more rib dinners over the course of development than on any project.', u'The airfield alone in the Guadacanal level is bigger than most maps from Medal of Honor: Allied Assault.', u"Once the truck asset was completed, it was realized they couldn't fit every member from Conlin's squad, so they purposely forced a member to run off during a Japanese artillery attack, and subsequently die moments later.", u'In order to make the Japanese soldiers fight more intelligently, there are over 520 cover nodes placed in Tarawa.', u'The M92 HMG found in many places in the game actually used 30-round stripper clips. However, the team found that the gun ate through that many bullets too fast, so they doubled the clip to improve gameplay.', u'There are well over 4,000 unique character animations in this game, from AI to scripted gags.', u'The airfield in the Guadacanal level had to be completely updated over 10 times to match the airfield changes in later levels of the mission.', u'WILHELM SCREAM: By Chief Mc Afee as he is killed by an explosion during the Pearl Harbor attack.', u'The gag at the end of the Guadalcanal level where Frank Minoso pulls the player up, took over a month to animate and line up correctly.', u'There are 43 placed soldier bodies used throughout Tarawa.', u'A particle effect called "Battle Smoke" is used throughout Tarawa to bring the scenes to life.', u'The original design of the Makin Atoll level called for a different infiltration location than the ex-filtration beach used in the final level. This was changed to promote a better sense of continuity across the mission.', u"An L6 Grasshopper couldn't have actually reached the Makin Atoll from friendly airstrips in 1942, but was visually the best choice for the developer's crashed patrol plane.", u"The Rookie tripping in the Makin Atoll level refers to a historical account of an accidental discharge of a US weapon soon after landing on Makin. It alerted the Japanese troops and blew the Marine Raiders' chance of surprise.", u'From 6 January 2003 to 8 October 2004, the game took 642 days to create.', u'When originally laying out the Makin Atoll level, the "Pathnode" limit was exceeded due to the enormous size of the level. "Pathnodes" are a series of markers placed by designers. Together they form a network of information which tells the characters where they can navigate and any special moves they can perform at each.', u'On the Guadalcanal level, the section in Henderson field after you\'ve helped allied planes get off the ground and are charged with taking a captured AA gun out, the first building you pass on your right has a radio in it with chatter from the pilots in the air. One bit of dialogue is a direct reference to the Trench Run scene from Star Wars;  "This is Red Five, I\'m goin\' in!"  "What about that tower?!"  "You worry about those cannons, I\'ll worry about the tower!"']

taglines: [u"You Don't Play You Volunteer"]
trivia: [u'In the "On Track" mission, in the town square there is wanted poster for Jimmy Patterson in a German disguise, complete with reward for his capture.', u'When you dress up as a cook and sneak into the mansion, look at the paintings on the wall. One of them is the Girl With A Pearl Earring.', u'When you go to Holland in the third mission, you come across a paratrooper named Corporal Langteau from the 82nd Airborne. Langteau is the surname of one of the writer/directors.', u'The starting level is D-Day when all the British, Canadian, American, and French troops fight the war against the Nazis. In The Diary Of Anne Frank (the book), they talk about the Normandy Landings (D-Day), and we can relate to this. As we know, this happens earlier before the Franks received the news.']

trivia: [u'The submarine pen where the player must destroy a prototype German submarine is an exact replica of the pens in the film "Raiders of the Lost Ark".', u'In the initial training mission, look in the back of one of the trucks: you will find a box with a number on it. This number is the same as the number found on the box holding the Ark of the Covenant in Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981).', u"Enemies don't bleed when shot; this is done to get a T rating.", u'Uses a modified id Tech 3 engine', u'Major Jack Grillo, the SAS operative held prisoner during your first mission and who accompanies you until early in the second, is named for lead sound designer Jack Grillo.']

taglines: [u'David is 11 years old. He weighs 60 pounds. He is 4 feet, 6 inches tall. He has brown hair. His love is real. But he is not.', u'Journey To A World Where Robots Dream And Desire', u'This Is Not A Game', u'This summer, discover the next step in evolution.', u'Do not speak the seven-word activation code unless you mean it.']
trivia: [u"In order to further his non-human appearance, each day before filming, any of Haley Joel Osment's exposed skin (face, arms, hands, etc.) was shaved to give him a more plastic look.", u'The list of words that Monica Swinton says to David to make him capable of love was the original list, written by Stanley Kubrick.', u"For the last seven minutes of A.I. the composer John Williams wrote a piano concerto, and it went over the length of the film. Steven Spielberg stopped the projector and told Williams to just let the music continue. Spielberg along with his editor Michael Kahn then re-edited the last seven minutes of movie into Williams' piano concerto. Spielberg did a similar thing years before E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982), where he and Carol Littleton edited the last 15 minutes into Williams' music.", u'Real-life amputees played some of the robots with missing limbs.', u'Haley Joel Osment suggested to Steven Spielberg that his character (David) should not blink. Spielberg agreed and went further to suggest that none of the androids should blink. In fact, several of them do (see goofs).', u"The World Trade Center is seen in the New York scenes of the film, set many years into the future after 2001. Less than three months after the film's release, they were destroyed in the September 11 terrorist attacks. Though risking controversy and criticism, Steven Spielberg left the twin towers in the DVD release.", u'Robin Williams actually recorded his dialogue for the film with Stanley Kubrick directing the recording session, he did it a long time before Steven Spielberg was attached to direct. In Bicentennial Man (1999) Williams plays an android who wants to become human.', u'The film also pioneered the virtual studio, a technique which allowed Steven Spielberg to walk through a virtual version of Rouge City with his camera and select shots. This technique was later used on "The Lord of the Rings" films.', u"David's head is very often shown with a 'halo' of circular light; the kitchen light, the dinner table lights, the lights in his bed, the shot from the rear-view mirror, the full moon, etc.", u'The movie was originally to be titled A.I., but after a survey it was revealed that too many people thought it was A1. The title was changed to A.I. Artificial Intelligence to prevent people from thinking it was about steak sauce.', u'In order to keep the film\'s PG-13 rating, a building resembling a penis was digitally removed from the "Rouge City" set.', u'Steven Spielberg used the water-filled set from The Perfect Storm (2000) for the flooded world of the future in this movie.', u'One of the buildings in Manhattan is actually an Apple Macintosh (Harman-Kardon) subwoofer.', u'Includes many of the trademarks of Stanley Kubrick. Among these are the narration at the beginning; portrayal of dehumanization and the dark side of human nature; the shots down the length of tall, parallel walls, and "The Glare", with David\'s head tilted and eyes looking upwards; the scene in the bathroom; the three-way conflict between David, Monica and Martin; an obsessed hero; imaginary worlds; a journey towards freedom/knowledge; the use of classical music in Richard Strauss\' "Der Rosenkavalier".', u'Shot in 67 days.', u'The band playing at the flesh fair, Ministry, was chosen by Stanley Kubrick himself, after overhearing a crew member playing a Ministry album one day on the set of Eyes Wide Shut (1999). Kubrick was also said to have liked the band because they used audio samples from his film Full Metal Jacket (1987) in their 1989 song "Thieves".', u'While this film was based on the Brian Aldiss short story "Supertoys Last All Summer Long," that short story has less influence on the movie than the famous poem by William Butler Yeats, "The Stolen Child." The text of the poem appears in the movie in two places, and certain stanzas take on literal meaning as well (e.g. "Till the moon has taken flight"). There are also many surprising similarities to the Philip K. Dick short story "Second Variety".', u'Although Jack Angel recorded all of his voice work for Teddy while separate from the rest of the production, he was asked to be on set every day, to re-record lines immediately when necessary.', u'When David and Gigolo Joe first arrive at Rouge City, and they drive through an arch shaped like a giant mouth, the film uses a piece of music preselected by Stanley Kubrick when he was still considering directing the film. John Williams thought the music fit perfectly with the way the scene was shot by Steven Spielberg.', u'As a promotional tool, the creators developed an elaborate internet game of discovery and problem solving, through hidden messages and puzzles in internet sites, telephone answering messages, e-mail accounts and clues in the film\'s trailers. The game, set in the world of A.I. involved websites registered in several countries around the world as well as telephone numbers from across the US, and a group of followers called "The Cloudmakers" followed the puzzle, sharing information.', u'It was Stanley Kubrick\'s idea to include industrial metal band "Ministry" to the movie. He was a big fan of them, and called lead singer Al Jourgensen asking him if he would like to be in the movie, Al, assuming it was just a prank, hung up on him.', u"Steven Spielberg's first writing credit since Poltergeist (1982).", u'John Williams quotes Richard Strauss\' "Der Rosenkavalier" waltz in the underscore during the approach Rouge City. This was a done to honor Stanley Kubrick, who left few notes regarding the music except to tell Steven Spielberg that this Strauss waltz should appear in the film. Williams refers to his score, which contains a number of musical allusions to Kubrick\'s films in addition to the waltz, as his \'homage a Kubrick\'.', u'The character name "Professor Hobby" is an obscure reference to Stanley Kubrick, who produced his films in the United Kingdom under the name "Hobby Films," which never appeared on screen in any of his films.', u'Much of the promotional material sent to movie theaters (posters, stand-ups, etc) misspelled Steven Spielberg\'s first name as "Stephen".', u'In some trailers for the movie, the words, "THIS IS NOT A GAME" were printed in glowing red letters at the bottom of the screen.', u"After seeing Chris Cunningham's work on Judge Dredd (1995), Stanley Kubrick head-hunted Chris Cunningham to design and supervise animatronic tests of the central robot child character in his version of the film A.I. Cunningham worked for over a year on the film A.I., before leaving to pursue a career as a director.", u'When work began on the movie in 1993, Joseph Mazzello was cast as David.', u'The hotel that Joe Gigolo walks into, when we are first introduced to the character, has the Hebrew words "Ahava Kshera" in neon. (Kosher Love)', u'The first part of Steven Spielberg\'s unofficial "running man" trilogy, continuing with Minority Report (2002) and concluding with Catch Me If You Can (2002).', u'Stan Winston claimed this was the most ambitious film he worked on in his lifetime.', u'Jerry Seinfeld was originally considered to voice and play the Comedian robot.', u'The film takes place in 2142 and 4142.', u'The first film to use computer animated Pre-Vis.', u"The Dreamworks SKG logo is featured several times, but most prominently in Martin's bed.", u'When David and Gigolo Joe are journeying through the woods, they mention Haddonfield, New Jersey, where Steven Spielberg lived for several years as a child.', u"The light fixture in Professor Hobby's lab was also used in the war room set of Dr. Strangelove.", u'William Hurt plays a remarkably similar "father of intelligent androids" scientist in BBC\'s sci-fi drama "Humans".', u'At the preview showings of the movie, special posters were placed in the theaters with a list of credits for the "Puppetmasters": Jordan Weisman, Elan Lee, Scot Bayless, Sean Stewart, Dan Carver, Pete Fenlon, Todd Lubsen, Paolo Malabuyo, Mark Selander, Mike Pondsmith, Lynn Knight, David Wells, Shawn Ferminger and Christine Hill. No regular movie posters were displayed that night. The "Puppetmasters" were a team from Microsoft, with Steven Spielberg\'s blessing, and quite outside the studio\'s wishes, that ran the Internet game. No movie credits were listed. Many of the players\' on-line game names were in vertical lists in an outline of the regular A.I. "Initials" movie poster.', u'Julianne Moore and Gwyneth Paltrow were considered for the role of Monica.', u"Before the film's release, Steven Spielberg assigned video game developers at Microsoft the task of developing a series of games based on the film for the XBox game system.", u'DIRECTOR_TRADEMARK(Steven Spielberg): [rear-view mirror]: Important image seen in rear-view mirror.', u'The imprinting words sequence: Cirrus, Socrates, Particle, Decibel, Hurricane, Dolphin, Tulip. (Monica, David, Monica)', u'Sound effects from "The Jetsons" television series theme song are used in the \'Doctor Know\' sequence when David & Gigolo Joe are asking questions.', u'Joe\'s medallion has "Shangri La" written on it when he starts playing music in the hotel room.', u"The Insecurity Robot's face was based on Stan Winston's.", u'Around 10 minutes into the film when first introduced to David, before David is actually seen in the bright lights, his image is that undoubtedly similar to that of the bodies of the aliens at the end of the film.', u'Cast member Robin Williams died on August 11, 2014. He was followed in death the next day by Lauren Bacall, mother of cast member Sam Robards.', u'Included among the "1001 Movies You Must See Before You Die", edited by Steven Schneider.', u'The film is included on Roger Ebert\'s "Great Movies" list.', u"For all his creativity, Kubrick was more interested in the 'appearance' of the future than what the future would actually be like. In '2001, a Space Odyssey,' the only women are servers and secretaries. In 'AI,' he imagines three wheeled pod cars (still driven by humans, which probably won't be the case in the future shown in the film), but people in this future are still using land line phones.", u'The screenplay "borrows" liberally from Osamu Tezuka\'s 1952 manga Tetsuwan Atomu (known as Astro Boy in the English speaking world), in which a scientist creates an emotion-capable boy robot to replace his dead son, but becomes frustrated when he realizes the robot will never grow up or become human. He sells Astro Boy to the Robot Circus, where he\'s forced to do battle with other robots in gladiator-style combat.', u'When Gigolo Joe and David fly through the flooded ruins of New York City in the Amphiblicopter, the Statue of Liberty can be briefly seen submerged in the ocean up to the bottom of her torch. In Russell Ash\'s 1996 book "Incredible Comparisons", it is described that if all the world\'s ice melted, this is exactly what would happen to the statue.', u"Jude Law and Ben Kingsley have both played Doctor John Watson in Sherlock Holmes films: Sherlock Holmes (2009) and Without a Clue (1988). Stanley Kubrick's film Barry Lyndon (1975) also featured two Watsons: Andr\xe9 Morell from The Hound of the Baskervilles (1959) and Michael Hordern from Young Sherlock Holmes (1985), which Steven Spielberg produced.", u'The novelization for Young Sherlock Holmes (1985), produced by Steven Spielberg says Mecca; this foreshadows mecha in AI. Also, the book uses the line "sixth sense"; Frank Marshall produced The Sixth Sense (1999) and Holmes and Spielberg directed Haley Joel Osment in this movie.', u'Steven Spielberg: [moon] The large moon visible in many scenes, is in the logo for the Flesh Fair, and appears as the design on Johnson\'s "balloon" aircraft.', u'Steven Spielberg: [music] John Williams score.', u'Stanley Kubrick worked on the project for 12 years before his death, but along the way decided to let Steven Spielberg direct, saying it was "closer to his sensibilities". The two collaborated for years, resulting in Kubrick giving Spielberg a complete treatment and lots of conceptual art for the film prior to his death. Even the much-criticized ending, that many viewers assumed was an addition that Spielberg had insisted on, was a part of Kubrick\'s original treatment.', u'There are no shots of David blinking until the end, when he is perceived as a real boy.', u'Although implied by the film, John Williams confirmed that David does indeed die in the very last scene of the film.', u'After Joe finds Samantha dead, he says that the number of seconds since the last time they met is 255,133, which is 2 days, 22 hours, 52 minutes and 13 seconds.', u"The elaborate series of promotional websites included information about the characters' lives after their last appearances in the film. For instance, one website revealed that Martin Swinton grew up to be an architect who, after being traumatized by David's disappearance, spent his career building sentient A.I. houses.", u'The SuperRobots look like the aliens from Close Encounters of the Third Kind (1977); apparently Steven Spielberg was using scenes dropped from the movie at the time due to special effects constraints and never filmed until they appeared in A.I.', u"Steven Spielberg: [father] David and Henry are somewhat distant from each other and, while Monica performs the imprinting sequence with David, Henry never does. Professor Hobby made David in the image of his own dead son. He tells David he's as real a boy as he's ever made; in a way, he has to lose his son again."]

title: The Dig
plot_outline: Three humans trapped on a distant planet discover its deadly secret which could be their undoing.
keywords: [u'alien', u'asteroid', u'h.p.-lovecraft', u'suicide', u'hand-cut-off', u'space', u'cave', u'light', u'bat', u'resurrection', u'survival', u'meteor-threatens-earth', u'insanity']
taglines: [u'A deep space adventure', u'"In the dead of space, something is alive"']
trivia: [u'Steven Spielberg originally intended the storyline to be an episode of his TV series Amazing Stories (1985). Its production costs would have been too high, so he approached LucasArts in 1989 with the idea of making it a video game instead, being very satisfied with the way Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989) had turned out. Spielberg also contributed to the screenplay by suggesting several puzzles and situations, and helping out with character development.', u'The second version of the game was primarily aimed at adults. Not only was it filled with heavy scientific lingo, it was also made quite violent and gory, as requested by Steven Spielberg. For example, one of the characters would turn into a bloody corpse after entering a cave filled with acid, another was to be ferociously attacked by bats, and there was to be an amputation scene featuring lots of blood, requiring a tourniquet. However, after receiving much criticism for some particularly violent and bloody scenes in his movie Jurassic Park (1993), Spielberg asked the design team to tone down the mood of the game, so that it would still be appropriate for children.', u"The first version that was inspired by Steven Spielberg's original idea was vastly different than the final result. It would have been situated in the future and feature a distant planet with ruins of four major cities, but no sophisticated aliens inhabiting them. The main characters were humans inspecting the planet. They would gradually find out that one of the cities waged war on the peaceful other three, making the planet so toxic that all survivors of each civilization were forced to go into stasis, to be revived when the planet became habitable again. The main characters would eventually revive all civilizations, and establish peace on the planet by converting the war-mongering tribe to a peaceful way of life.", u'During its production, The Dig went through three significantly different versions of the plot and four changes of project leaders.', u'Before entering the door to the first tram platform, Boston Low jokes that there may be a mad scientist with a pretty girl and a talking robot on the other side. This is a reference to the classic science fiction movie Forbidden Planet (1956), which is also about a couple of astronauts arriving on a planet full of technology from a society that has long since died out (and where they indeed find a deranged professor and his pretty daughter). Forbidden Planet was one of the main inspirations for the game.', u'Steven Spielberg envisioned the game originally as a hybrid between Forbidden Planet (1956) (a planet full of alien technology from a long-since disappeared civilization) and The Treasure of the Sierra Madre (1948) (people unable to trust one another because of growing greed and paranoia).', u'Several pieces of artwork for the game showed four astronauts instead of three, originating from the second version of the game which had four main characters. The fourth character was a Japanese business man who co-funded the mission and therefore became part of the crew. He was eventually written out of the game, and all artwork produced thereafter showed three astronauts.', u"During the first brainstorm session for the game at LucasArts, a large earthquake hit the Los Angeles area. Many have jokingly described the earthquake as a bad omen of the so-called 'Dig curse': the production of the game was indeed plagued by creative problems, re-writes, changes in management, and the final product was not released until many years after its first conception (although to generally favorable reviews).", u'As specified in the game\'s manual, the name of the alien planet is Cocytus. The planet is never named as such within the game; the characters only ever refer to it as "this place" or "alien planet". Originally, Brink was to come up with the nickname, but this piece of dialogue was scrapped.', u"Originally, the gameplay included much more survival elements, requiring the player to look for food and water to stay alive. When Sean Clark took over, he removed these elements because they would only frustrate the player. He also simplified the interface, moving away from the traditional 'verb interface' that LucasArts had used for years, where the player performs actions by combining verb commands with objects.", u'In an early version of the game, Boston Low and Judith (not Maggie) Robbins both had blond hair. There was also an object called the Klein bottle, which would mirror the appearance of a character (i.e. making them left-handed instead of right-handed). This would be needed to solve several puzzles.', u'The second version of the story was largely similar to the final version. The major differences were that a fourth main character was added, a Japanese business man who had funded the space flight, and therefore demanded to be part of its crew; the aliens had also found a space dimension in which they could live forever, but they were quite happy there, as opposed to in the final version. Their intention was to gather several space faring species to their planet, and make the surrounding particularly hostile, so that only the most clever individuals would find out how to enter the dimension, and therefore be worthy of it.', u"The planet was named Cocytus by the game's creators. In Greek mythology, Cocytus is one of the five rivers that run around the Underworld, the place where dead souls end up after death. The rivers (the Styx being the most famous) separate the Underworld from the world of the living, and need to be crossed to gain access to the afterlife. Cocytus literally means 'Lamentation', and is considered the river of wailing. The name seems fitting, since the Cocytans in the game used their planet to cross into some form of afterlife, where they can only exist as non-corporeal beings, a move they now regret.", u"Early in the game, Ludger Brink objects when Boston Low digs up a grave, where he retrieves a jawbone. Ironically, that same bone is later used to save Brink's life by cutting off his hand that got trapped between rocks."]

title: Amazing Stories
plot_outline: Truly amazing, fantastical, funny, and odd, and sometimes scary, sad, and endearing stories are portrayed. Many famous actors, actresses, and directors make guest appearances.
keywords: [u'anthology']
taglines: [u'In the extraordinary worlds of Amazing Stories!', u'As one experience ends... Another adventure begins.']
trivia: [u'*batteries not included (1987) was originally intended to be an episode of this series until Steven Spielberg decided to expand it into a feature film.', u'The title is taken from a bi-monthly, science fiction journal famous in the 1940s and 1950s, and edited by television and film writer Howard Browne.', u'The episodes "The Mission", "Go to the Head of the Class", and "Mummy Daddy" were edited into a single movie titled "Storie incredibili" for the Italian market. The film was theatrically released on June 19, 1987.', u"Rain Phoenix's television series debut, and first acting role."]
release_dates: [u'USA::29 September 1985', u'France::10 July 1986 (theatrical release)', u'Finland::26 June 1987 (theatrical release)', u'UK::26 April 1992', u'Germany::8 March 1993']

title: The Goonies
plot_outline: In order to save their home from foreclosure, a group of misfits set out to find a pirate's ancient valuable treasure.

taglines: [u'They call themselves "The Goonies." The secret caves. The old lighthouse. The lost map. The treacherous traps. The hidden treasure. And Sloth... Join the adventure.', u'The pirates map, The villainous crooks, The underground caverns, The booby traps, the skeletons, The monster, the lost treasure, and the magic that is... THE GOONIES', u"It's excitement all the way as Steven Spielberg and Richard Donner, the makers of 'Indiana Jones', 'Gremlins' and 'Superman', combine forces to create the Family Adventure of the year!"]
trivia: [u'According to Sean Astin, he was allowed to keep the treasure map used in the film. Several years later his mother Patty Duke discovered it, thought it was just a crinkled piece of paper, and threw it in the trash.', u'When rocks are falling from the cave ceiling, Jonathan Ke Quan (Data) screams "Holy S-H-I-T!" He said he spelled the expletive because his mother made him promise not to use any bad language in the movie.', u'When the Fratelli brothers argue Anne Ramsey really slaps Robert Davi. She was told to hit him as hard as she could.', u'The pirate ship was entirely real. All the shots were filmed in the ship. After the film, it was offered to anyone who would take it. No one wanted it, so the ship was scrapped.', u"Production Designer J. Michael Riva said in a National Public Radio interview that before shooting the first scenes with the prop map, he thought that it looked good but not old enough, so in his hotel room, he aged it with coffee and (when he couldn't find paint) his own blood.", u"During Chunk's (Jeff Cohen) confession scene, two things he admits to are pushing his sister Edie down the stairs and blaming it on the dog, and stealing his uncle Max's toupee. Cohen's real-life sister is named Edie, and he has an uncle named Max.", u"Richard Donner kept both One-Eyed Willie's head and a model for the ship.", u'The cast was not allowed to see the pirate ship before the scene was shot, as director Richard Donner wanted to catch their genuine reactions at the size and scope of it. When they did see it, Josh Brolin was so surprised that he exclaimed "Holy shit!" The scene had to be re-shot.', u"One Eyed Willie's ship, The Inferno, was 105 feet long and took 2-1/2 months to construct. It was modeled after Errol Flynn's ship in The Sea Hawk (1940). The sails required more than than 7,000 square feet of material, the largest measured 30ft by 60ft. Some of the ship's rigging was recycled for the Pirates of the Caribbean ship at Disneyland, which was being renovated at the time.", u'The bats were made of crumpled, black pieces of crepe paper that were shot out of an air cannon.', u'June 7th was officially declared "Goonies Day" by the Mayor of Astoria (where the movie was filmed) during the 25th Anniversary Celebration in 2010.', u'During filming, Martha Plimpton made a bet with director Richard Donner that she would stop biting her nails. Donner paid up several years later, while they were doing the DVD commentary.', u'Mostly shot in sequence. Total production took five months.', u'The Goonies Oath that was cut out goes as follows: "I will never betray my goon dock friends / We will stick together until the whole world ends / Through heaven and hell, and nuclear war / Good pals like us, will stick like tar / In the city, or the country, or the forest, or the boonies / I am proudly declared a fellow Goonie."', u'Jeff Cohen got the chicken pox after he got the role of Chunk. He showed up to the set anyway, afraid that they would have replaced him otherwise.', u"John Matuszak's make-up took 5 hours to complete. One of the eyes (which was out of place on the face) was mechanically operated off-screen by remote control. Someone would count down, and Matuszak would blink his other eye in synchronization. The cast was told not to get him wet in scenes outside of the pirate ship. Unfortunately, he got wet, delaying filming for an entire day.", u'The last name of the brothers who are chasing the Goonies is Fratelli. Fratelli means "brothers" in Italian.', u'The name "Rube G" can be seen painted on the contraption that opens the yard gate for Chunk near the beginning of the movie. This is in reference to Rube Goldberg, the Pulitzer Prize winning cartoonist who drew whimsical machines that achieved simple results in difficult ways.', u'Cyndi Lauper co-wrote the theme song "Goonies R Good Enough", and shot a music video that features a cameo by the film\'s executive producer Steven Spielberg. The 12-minute video basically tells the movie\'s story as a musical. Cyndi Lauper plays Cyndi (a new Goonie recruit), The Bangles play pirates, and Andr\xe9 the Giant plays Sloth.', u'According to director Richard Donner in an interview with "The Directors", producer Steven Spielberg instructed the cast members to act cold and distant toward Donner on the last week of filming which puzzled him. Shortly after filming wrapped, Donner went to his beach house in Hawaii, ran into a frenzied neighbor who took up his entire day. When he arrived home, the entire cast was there to celebrate with a cookout. Spielberg flew them over to Hawaii on the promise that they not speak a word of the surprise to Donner, which prompted them to act the way they were on the last week of filming.', u'Robert Davi, who is a trained opera singer, came up with the idea where he sings to Sloth from Giacomo Puccini\'s opera "Madama Butterfly."', u"One-Eyed Willy's skull was made from real bone.", u'Jeff Cohen thought of his mother dying to generate tears during his "confession" scene with the Fratellis.', u'Near the end of the movie, Data says something in Chinese and Chinese subtitles are shown. The subtitles translate to "He is a big strong man".', u'Richard Donner unintentionally started giggling when they filmed the scene which Chunk starts crying, when the ice cream gets taken off him by Jake and it was kept in the film. If you listen carefully, you can hear the director giggling off-screen, when Jake takes the plastic spoon off Chunk and Chunk starts to cry.', u"Josh Brolin's big screen debut.", u'On the DVD commentary, Jeff Cohen (Chunk) claims that the confession of puking off the theater balcony is not based on anything in real life. This is incorrect. The basis for the theater story was a real-life prank pulled by Executive Producer Steven Spielberg while growing up in Phoenix, AZ.', u"The late Corey Haim auditioned for the role of Mouth, but the role was given to Corey Feldman instead. At the time the two Coreys hadn't met, but they were later cast together in The Lost Boys (1987) and became best friends, starring in 6 more movies together. In License to Drive (1988), Feldman auditioned for the lead role of Les Anderson, but lost it to Haim.", u'John Matuszak (Sloth) is wearing a t-shirt of the Oakland Raiders, a team he once played on.', u'All the companions are referred to by nicknames, and their real names are either rarely mentioned or not mentioned at all: Michael Walsh - Mikey; Clark Devereaux - Mouth; Richard Wang - Data; Brandon Walsh - Brand; Lawrence Cohen - Chunk; Andrea Theresa Carmichael - Andy; Stephanie Steinbrenner - Stef; Lotney Fratelli - Sloth.', u'More than 900,000 gallons of water was used in the movie.', u"During filming Steven Spielberg and Richard Donner sent the boys to the Dodger Stadium for Michael Jackson's Victory concert.", u"Though they were divorcing at the time, Patty Duke claims that she and John Astin held hands and sobbed through the entire film when they saw it for the first time. Patty is Sean Astin's mother and John was his step-father.", u'Ma Fratelli and her sons are based on the early-20th-century legend of Kate Barker (known as Ma Barker) and her boys.', u'When NBC broadcast the film, they added a scene of Chunk and Sloth following the trail of the other Goonies, but cut out 20 minutes.', u"Mikey mentions Michael Jackson going over to Chunk's house in one scene. In real life, Corey Feldman (who played Mouth) was close friends with the singer and the two later became estranged. Feldman attended Michael Jackson's memorial service after his death in June 2009.", u"For one line of dialogue, Corey Feldman had to dub in the name of fast-food chain Godfather's Pizza when Straw Hat Pizza refused participation in the film.", u'Despite the fact that no "uncut" version has been released on home media when basic cable/local stations air the film the version used includes both the "Stop and Shop" and "Giant Octopus" sequences cut from final version.', u'In the storybook of the film, One-Eyed Willy\'s back-story is told by Francis Fratelli, when The Fratelli\'s take the doubloon from Chunk. One-Eyed Willy, whose real name is William B. Pordobel, was a court jester, before becoming an ingenious pirate, when he was banished from five Spanish courts, for his practical jokes and formed a band of pirates, whom marauded hundreds of the king\'s ships and accumulated a treasure worth millions. But, Willy\'s ship "Inferno" was attacked by three of the King\'s ships and Willy steered his ship into a hidden underground cavern and was sealed within by the canon fire from the British. Willy and his men had spent a couple of years trying to repair the ship and had built underground caves with weird booby traps to protect the treasure and one of Willy\'s men escaped to tell Willy\'s story, which became a legend.', u'The newspaper article photo of Chester Copperpot is actor Keenan Wynn.', u'"Shit" or "bullshit"is uttered 19 times, not counting the line "Holy S-H-I-T!"', u'The screenplay was written by Chris Columbus, who also wrote Gremlins (1984). There is an Easter egg to Gremlins (1984). When Chunk calls the police, the officer says, "[This call] is like the prank about creatures that multiply when you throw water on them."', u"The oil substance shot out of Data's slick shoes was made of glycerin, water and food coloring.", u'Producer trademark (Steven Spielberg): [007] Data\'s belt has "007" inscribed on it. He also listens to the James Bond theme before sliding on the rope over to Mikey\'s.', u'The arcade game you see Chunk playing in the Pizza place at the beginning of the film is "Cliff Hanger (1983)".', u"Chris Columbus sold Steven Spielberg the script along with Gremlins (1984) but his career didn't really take off until the massive success of Home Alone (1990).", u'According to his autobiography "Corerography", Corey Feldman and Martha Plimpton did not get along at all.', u'The grappling hook belt buckle is a nod to Hayao Miyazaki\'s The Castle of Cagliostro (1979) and the main character Lupin who uses it. Spielberg was a huge fan of the movie, calling it "one of the greatest adventure movies".', u"In the storybook of the film, there was a scene, that was not in the film. Mikey, Mouth, Brand, Data, Andi and Stef discover a room with a dangling skeleton in a pirate's costume. The Goonies had to tickle the skeleton's elbow, which would point to one of three tunnels, where they must go. Stef tickles the skeleton's elbow and it points to the middle cave and The Goonies continue the search for One-Eyed Willy's treasure.", u'At one point in the movie, the character played by Sean Astin cries out "Holy Mackenzie!" Sean Astin\'s brother is Mackenzie Astin.', u'When the boys are sitting in the living room watching MTV, they weren\'t actually watching the Cyndi Lauper "Good Enough" video, which was developed six months after filming wrapped up.', u"In the original version of this film, the woman hired by Mikey's mother is a Hispanic named Rosalita (Lupe Ontiveros), and Mouth helps Mrs. Walsh by translating her commands into Spanish. In the Spanish version of this film, Rosalita becomes an Italian woman named Rossanna. The Italian used by the Spanish dubber is much better than the Spanish used by Corey Feldman.", u'The black and white movie that Mouth watches on his TV in the first scene is the car chase scene from Some Like It Hot (1959), directed by Billy Wilder.', u'Corey Feldman met fellow child actor and soon to be best friend Corey Haim while auditioning.', u'Producer Steven Spielberg directed at least one scene in this movie.', u"The script gives One-Eye Willie's full name as William B. Pordobell. This resembles Portobelo, a Panamanian port which has long been home to pirates.", u"Chester Copperpot's skeleton was made from plastic.", u'According to a website dedicated to the film, in 2002, it was mentioned on the cast list, that the skeleton of One-Eyed Willy was a man called Raul Woo whom died from lead poisoning.', u"After having a great working relationship with Steven Spielberg on Gremlins (1984), Spielberg produced the next two films Chris Columbus scripted, The Goonies (1985), based on an idea Spielberg had, and Young Sherlock Holmes (1985), which was Columbus's idea, which altogether was two years working on those three films.", u'The original poster art (not used on the video tape box) featured the cast dangling from the feet of another with the top one hanging on a rock. Some of the newspaper ads featured slightly different artwork with the characters drawn in a different order from top to bottom.', u'The real life banter between Joe Pantoliano (Francis) and Robert Davi (Jake) during their joint audition won them the roles for the movie.', u"Heather Langenkamp auditioned for the role of Andy. Steven Spielberg and Richard Donner felt that she had given a great audition and was the right physical type for the role. However she was 20 years old at the time. The script described her as being 17 years old and both Spielberg and Donner felt that Langenkamp was too old for the role. Langenkamp was angry about it for years. At the same time Spielberg also felt bad about turning her down. 7 years later, Spielberg would offer Langenkamp the role of Dr. Ellie Sattler in Jurassic Park (1993) as a way of apologizing to her. But she turned it down because she was about to star in Wes Craven's New Nightmare (1994).", u'When Sloth rips off his outer shirt, he reveals a Superman t-shirt, accompanied by the John Williams Superman theme.. Director Richard Donner directed Superman (1978) and parts of Superman II (1980).', u'The MAD Magazines Mikey looks through at his house are #208 July 1979, #124 January 1969 and #254 December 1984 (this issue can be seen in the Stop-N-Snack Scene eventually cut from the film. MAD Magazine made a Parody out of this movie in late 1985.', u"In the scene where Chunk breaks the water cooler bottle, his line of 'I got it! I got it! ... I don't got it!' is a nod to the film _High Anxiety_.", u'When Chunk is hiding from the Fratellis in the refrigerator with the dead body, he sneezes loudly. As Mama Fratelli exits the room she unwittingly says "Gesundheit!", the German word for "Health" used as a response to a sneeze.', u'The football players from Astoria High School had to shoot the tackling sequence in the opening scene 13 times (explaining why the receiver is so muddy when he jumps up from being tackled) and later had to sign papers to keep from being credited. If they were In fact credited, they would have to accept wages for their contribution to the film and therefore would not be able to play football on the college level. This was a wise decision since the one who was being tackled went on to have an impressive future in college football.', u'The dead FBI agent is played by stunt performer Ted Grossman.', u"The music that plays on Data's stereo when he swings through the front door of Brand and Mikey's house early in the film is the James Bond theme song composed by Monty Norman. Four years after the film's release, Robert Davi (Jake Fratelli) would play the main antagonist of the 1989 James Bond film Licence to Kill (1989).", u'As mentioned elsewhere, a song called "8 Arms To Hold You" was made for this film. "Eight Arms To Hold You" was also a working title for the Beatles movie Help! (1965).', u'In the 1988 ITV broadcast of the film. In the scene which Chunk meets Sloth. The bit which Sloth growls at Chunk was cut because the ITV network felt that it would frighten younger viewers watching the film. And it was cut from Chunk to saying "Hi! Sir. My name is Lawrence." to Sloth giggling and bouncing in his chair in excitement and Chunk shouting "Get me out of here!!".', u"On a internet website called Imagine Casting, which members can make up their own casts in films. A spin-off film which is a prequel to the film following Chester Copperpot as searches for One-Eyed Willy's treasure was submitted and on the website actor Charles Dance was cast as Chester Copperpot.", u'In 2017, a LEGO Dimensions video game of the film for PS4 "LEGO Dimensions - The Goonies Level Pack" was released. In the trailer for the game, Excalibur Batman tells the story of "The Goonies" and is seen giving Sloth a Batman costume and is seen playing on the bone piano. In the game, Chunk and Sloth set off into the caves and go after the other Goonies and The Frattelli\'s whom are searching for One-Eyed Willy\'s ship.', u"The name of the plumbing company that Mouth's Dad owns is Mad Jack's Plumbing. It can be seen on the van in the opening sequence.", u'In the 1992 ITV broadcast of the film in the UK, the frightening scene which Andi screams, when The Goonies discover Chester Copperpot\'s skeleton was cut and it is cut from, The Goonies approaching Copperpot\'s skeleton, which Mikey says "Look, you guy! A lantern! Somebody must had been before us." to Chunk crying as he continues telling his life story to the Fratellis. The scene was left intact and uncut in the 1988 ITV broadcast.', u"In the scene which Mikey finds One-Eyed Willy's skeleton aboard The Inferno, one of the skeletons of the pirates has hand against his neck which implies that the pirate may had choked to death. If so, it's most likely he may had been poisoned by One-Eyed Willy.", u'Much of the theme music for the film comes from the 1948 Adventures of Don Juan (1948) starring Errol Flynn. Sloth is seen in his dungeon room watching similar swashbuckling films from the 1940s and 50s on TV and imagines himself a hero like Flynn, as evidenced by his sliding/slicing down the sail of the pirate ship near the end, which is also from another Errol Flynn film.', u'Novelisation by James Kahn.', u'The film has mild swearing like the other Steven Spielberg produced Chris Columbus scripted film of that year, Young Sherlock Holmes (1985); both films also have pipe organs. Data idolizes James Bond and Spielberg and Columbus are huge Bond fans, and Holmes has much gadgetry on his person, like Data. The book uses the word omen; Richard Donner directed The Omen (1976). The book also describes one of the characters as a superman to Holmes; this may be an in-joke to Donner who directed The Goonies (1985) and the first two Superman movies.', u"The film has horror undertones: Jake Fratelli faking his suicide in a police cell to stage a breakout. Light streaming through gaps in the walls lightens the otherwise moody darkness, dust int he air, floorboards creaking for added impact. It sets an uneasy tone and this is thoroughly ramped up when the Fratellis turn up. Mama Fratelli whom spat out a threat in her perfectly gruff voice. Data almost falling down on a trap of some metal spikes. Chunk's confession scene and The Goonies finding a frozen corpse in a refrigerator. David Grusin's exquisite score which is playful and melodic. The Fratellis locking Sloth in the basement. The brutal traps which could kill The Goonies at any moment and the sense of unease and danger.", u'The scene which Jake Fratelli is found hanged in his jail cell, which he pretends to have committed suicide and overpowers the guard was edited in the 1988 ITV broadcast in the United Kingdom. It cuts from the guard saying "You too down there. Hey turkey..." to the next scene, which Francis Fratelli is seen pouring a ring of gasoline around the front entrance of the jail.', u'Coincidence or not, one of the Goonies is Brand - Brandon Walsh, played by Josh Brolin. Several years later, in 1990, the same character of Brandon Walsh appeared once again on Beverly Hills 90210, a famous TV series, this time played by Jason Priestley.', u'All of the younger characters last names end with the letter"N". Astin, Brolin, Cohen, Feldman, Green, Plimpton, and Quan. And non-goonie Troy (Steve Antin).', u'Both John Matuszak and Joe Pantoliano made guest appearances on MASH during season 10.', u"The film is actress Sophia Myles's favorite film.", u"Anne Ramsey would later star in The River Pirates (1988) as The Hag, It was one of Anne Ramsey's final acting roles prior to her death on August 11th 1988 at the age of 59.", u'Mary Ellen Trainor who plays Mrs Walsh would later go on to play a police psychologist in Lethal Weapon which is also directed by Richard Donner.', u'According to a nearby calendar, the film is set in October.', u"A year before the film's release, Robert Davi and Joe Pantoliano guest starred in Hart to Hart: Always Elizabeth (1984) (TV Series).", u"Jennie Lew Tugend: assistant to director Richard Donner, has a small role as Data's mom.", u'Richard Donner: the gray-haired sheriff on the quads in the final scene.', u'According to international maritime salvage law, the rights to a salvage vessel and its contents go to the person or persons who first successfully brings something off the vessel in question. Since Mikey brought the jewels off the ship, the Inferno and everything on it belongs to him.', u'The kids who played the Goonies were allowed to bring some of their families into the final scene where they are reunited.', u"The novelization of the movie confirms that Chunk's parents actually do 'adopt' Sloth, going so far as to throw him a Bar Mitzvah.", u"Some of the crew members played extras in the film. One cameraman played Mouth's father. Another played the dead man in the freezer. And an assistant director plays one of the cops on the AV scooters on the beach at the end.", u'The soundtrack includes "8 Arms To Hold You" by "The Goon Squad". It was removed from the film when the octopus scene was cut. The filmmakers were convinced the song could be a hit, so it was pressed as a 12" dance single. It sold miserably due to lack of promotion. It has become one of the rarest, most valuable Goonie-related items.', u"At the end, where all of the families are reunited, Jeff Cohen's mom plays Chunk's mom.", u"The Lou Gehrig baseball card that Mikey finds on Chester Copperpot's body is worth $275,000 at auction (in mint condition)", u"In the novelization of the film, when Mikey finds One-Eyed Willy's skeleton, he discovers One-Eyed Willy has an asthma inhaler, which Mikey suffers from asthma and this leads Mikey to believe that he is One-Eyed Willy's reincarnation and that it was his destiny to find One-Eyed Willy's treasure.", u"When the Goonies first discover the treasure map they ask Mouth (the only member of the group fluent in Spanish) to translate the Spanish writing on the map to English so they can all understand it. He does, reading aloud the instructions on how to locate the treasure. What he reads is in common rhyming stanzas. Although it is unlikely that Mouth (someone who, the movie has previously shown, is prone to make translation mistakes even under non-poetic, non-rhyming circumstances) would be able to translate the text into English and spontaneously maintain its rhyme, it is not impossible. Many talented translators of rhyming non-English poetry have managed to maintain the rhyming even after the poetry was translated into English; one famous twentieth-century example is Richard Wilbur's acclaimed work as a translator of the seventeenth century comedies by the French playwright Moli\xe8re, which still rhyme and maintain their cleverness in Wilbur's translations.", u"Chunk knocking over the statue which the genitals break off the statue foreshadows The Goonies searching for One-Eyed Willy and Mikey finding One-Eyed Willy's skeleton. Willy is a slang word for penis.", u'The bowling ball that rolls across the railing, which Mikey releases from a tin bucket when he pulls a cord, that falls into another bucket and sets off the contraption that opens the yard gate for Chunk at the beginning of the film foreshadows the cannonball in the Triple Stones booby trap that Mikey sets off.', u'Mouth is called Mouth because he is smart mouthed. And it also foreshadows Mouth stuffing a pearl necklace and jewels in his mouth, which Momma Fratelli pulls the pearl necklace out of his neck and the jewels come out his mouth, when Momma Fratelli smacks him on the back of the heads.', u"The skull lamp in Mikey's bedroom and the skeleton seen in the fish tank when Chunk tells Mikey, Brand and Mouth about the car chase between the Fratellis and the police at the beginning of the movie foreshadows Mikey, Brand, Andi, Stef, Data and Mouth discovering the skeletons of Chester Copperpot, One-Eyed Willy and the dead pirates in the caves.", u"When the Goonies are on the ship near the end of the movie, Sloth reveals a Superman t-shirt (with the Superman theme playing). It's clearly a reference to the fact that Richard Donner was the director of Superman - The Movie.", u"After Mikey sets off the boulder trap which would have blocked off the caves and tunnels preventing anyone else from getting through, Mama, Jake and Fratelli are seen crossing through the tunnel and finding Chester Copperpot's skeleton.", u'Is the Goondocks Waterslide Magical and how comes the Goonies slid down the Waterslide and how comes they came out of different Waterslide Ports.']

title: Poltergeist
plot_outline: A family's home is haunted by a host of ghosts.
